definitions: To establish or originate (an institution or organization), especially with an endowment or financial support.
To lay the base or foundation of (a building or structure).
To base (a principle, idea, etc.) on something.
To discover or locate something, typically after a search or by chance.
To determine that someone or something is in a particular state or has a particular quality.
examples: They found a new species of bird.
She found the answer to the problem.
He found himself in a difficult situation.
The jury found the defendant guilty.
